comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Inez Milholland Boissevain: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inez_Milholland She's also in this photo from that day: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/7753232100/

comment.author: 76016463@N00
35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to both of you for your research. What a character he must have been. We'll add the date and other information to this photo and the other one from the same day.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: My research leads me to think that the woman to the left of Sen. O'Gorman is Mrs. William L. Colt, and the woman on is right is Mrs. Boissevain. The Bain captioners must have switched them. They got the names correct is this image: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/7753232100/ We'll make the correction to the record the next time we update.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: That makes sense to me.  The woman with the veil doesn't look like any other images of Inez Milholland, anyway.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: I suppose the woman with the fox around her neck is Inez Milholland, though it doesn't look a lot like other photos of her: . An excellent biographical sketch of her is at the Vassar website: vcencyclopedia.vassar.edu/alumni/inez-milholland.html

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Aloysius_O%27Gorman James Aloysius O'Gorman, Sr. (May 5, 1860 – May 17, 1943) was a one-term United States Senator from New York.
